title: TeenWolf80
author: TeenWolf80
content: I recently migrated my BRD wallet to the CoinBase wallet app. I’ve made a few smaller transactions since importing from BRD.I made two transactions from the app (outgoing) several hours ago and they still have 0 confirmations.  Normally I wouldn’t be worried, but I just downloaded the CoinBase Wallet app on another device and imported the same wallet — on the new device there is no sign of the transactions AND it’s showing the wallet balance as $0?!?! I also ran the first transaction through an accelerator to no avail.Can anyone take a peek and let me know what could be wrong?Transaction Hashes:aa6183eb476f2b41ae98893e4a55b8d7dc80e068e3c731f8d11516e9c982eb2085dcef97d8e99491201c577e9165f328c4def1a749c7b26369561aa056d6e37b

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.created_time: June 13, 2022, 12:45:39 PMLast edit: June 13, 2022, 11:56:56 PM by Charles-Tim
comments.body: Check this guide on how to make use of CPFP: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5285192If you are using seed phrase or private key wallet, you will be able to make use of CPFP. I will advice you to use Electrum wallet (to import the seed phrase), you will be able to make use of RBF instead to pump the fee which is better and will save you fee. You can not use RBF on Coinbase noncustododial wallet and most other wallet as they do not support RBF feature.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.created_time: June 13, 2022, 01:08:17 PMLast edit: June 13, 2022, 01:41:33 PM by OmegaStarScream
comments.body: If you can't see the transactions now, I doubt you'll see them once the transactions get confirmed. It must be a visual glitch. But as mentioned above, you should go with Electrum instead. Here's a step-by-step guide on how to restore your wallet (for BRD users)[1]. The transactions should show once you complete the steps.[1] https://bitcoinelectrum.com/restoring-your-multibithd-wallet-in-electrum/

comments.author: nc50lc
comments.body: Quote from: TeenWolf80 on June 13, 2022, 12:28:00 PMI made two transactions from the app (outgoing) several hours ago and they still have 0 confirmations.  Normally I wouldn’t be worried, but I just downloaded the CoinBase Wallet app on another device and imported the same wallet — on the new device there is no sign of the transactions AND it’s showing the wallet balance as $0?!?! I also ran the first transaction through an accelerator to no avail.It should still be there since your two transactions are still valid,it's just the Coinbase Wallet app doesn't check for BRD wallet's derivation path by default, so it takes time for their server to check for the balance.If you need to speed it up, enable "Toggle BRD BTC Scanning" in the Advanced setting.BTW, the transactions aren't confirmed yet due to the network's average fee rate is quite high at the moment.

comments.author: TeenWolf80
comments.body: Are there any paid accelerators that take fiat payments?

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: TeenWolf80 on June 13, 2022, 02:19:11 PMAre there any paid accelerators that take fiat payments? Check this Lucius thread, it is active again: https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5332642.msg60349909#msg60349909Paying Accelerator will demand for high fee which can be up to or more than $500. So, using the free accelerator can be helpful. Both of your transactions are more than 10 sat/vbyte each, so post the txid and the help needed on Lucius thread.Edit: Sorry, both each are not up to 10 sat/byte, not sat/vbyte.. According to the rules, it is in byte, not vbyte. https://www.viabtc.com/tools/txaccelerator

comments.author: BitMaxz
comments.body: Quote from: TeenWolf80 on June 13, 2022, 02:19:11 PMAre there any paid accelerators that take fiat payments? How much did you transfer? It's not worth paying an accelerator if the BTC you transfer is not big. And Viabtc currently does not accept fiat they only accept BTC, BCH, and LTC.Why not import your wallet to the Electrum so that you can bump the fee if the transaction is already in the blockchain.?

comments.author: Charles-Tim
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on June 13, 2022, 10:14:28 PMWhy not import your wallet to the Electrum so that you can bump the fee if the transaction is already in the blockchain.?Both transactions do not support replace-by-fee. Coinbase noncustododial wallet do not support RBF, I also check that using blockchain explorer. The best option is to use CPFP or he should wait for the mempool to get less congested@TeenWolf80, to under CPFP better, you can read these:All about "stuck" transactions and what you can do to fix them[TUTORIAL]getting a low-fee transaction unstuck by creating a CPFP with electrum

comments.author: nc50lc
comments.body: Quote from: BitMaxz on June 13, 2022, 10:14:28 PMHow much did you transfer? It's not worth paying an accelerator if the BTC you transfer is not big.Both of his transaction IDs are posted in the OP.The transactions are now confirmed, guess the only issue left is his balance showing on his wallet which should have been solved by the "BRD scanning" toggle.

comments.author: NotATether
comments.body: Quote from: Charles-Tim on June 14, 2022, 12:05:22 AMBoth transactions do not support replace-by-fee. Coinbase noncustododial wallet do not support RBF, I also check that using blockchain explorer. The best option is to use CPFP or he should wait for the mempool to get less congestedCPFP will only work if OP has more bitcoins to make a second transaction (partiularly, if the transaction has unconfirmed "change" outputs that go back to your wallet). I doubt this is the case from the hint that OP is asking for accelerators that accept fiat money.
